text: The Kazakh ambassador in New Delhi is the official representative of the Government in Astana to the Government of India. *The first new Embassy of India in Central Asia was opened in 1992 in Almaty, and Kazakhstan opened its embassy in New Delhi in 1993. ==List of representatives== {| class="wikitable sortable" !| Diplomatic agrément/Diplomatic accreditation !| ambassador !| Russian language :ru:Послы Казахстана в России !| Observations !| Prime Minister of Kazakhstan !| List of Prime Ministers of India !| Term end |- | |Rashid Turarovich Ibraev |:ru:Ибраев, Рашид Турарович |1998: Kazakhstan's ambassador to Azerbai jan. Rashid Ibrayev, |Akezhan Kazhegeldin |P. V. Narasimha Rao | |- | |Askar Shakirov |Шакиров Аскар | |Nurlan Balgimbayev |Atal Bihari Vajpayee | |- | |Kairat Umarov |:ru:Умаров, Кайрат Ермекович |Qayrat Omarow |Daniyal Akhmetov |Manmohan Singh | |- | |Doulat Kuanyshev |Куанышев Дулат |(born 29.10.1960) 05.2003-09.2005 ambassador to ParisDoulat Kuanyshev |Karim Massimov |Manmohan Singh | |- | |Bulat Sergazyuly Sarsenbayev |:ru:Сарсенбаев, Булат Сергазиевич | |Serik Akhmetov |Narendra Modi | |} *India–Kazakhstan relations == References == India Kazakhstan
title: List of ambassadors of Kazakhstan to India
